    Graphs

    Indifference curve lines

    indifference_lines.Rd

    This function calculates indifference curves to be drawn on the consumption path graph.

    Usage

    indifference_lines(
  .rebound_data,
  graph_type = ReboundTools::graph_types$consumption,
  graph_params = ReboundTools::path_graph_params,
  q_dot_s_orig = ReboundTools::orig_vars$q_dot_s_orig,
  C_dot_o_orig = ReboundTools::orig_vars$C_dot_o_orig,
  f_Cs_orig = ReboundTools::orig_vars$f_Cs_orig,
  sigma = ReboundTools::orig_vars$sigma,
  q_dot_s_hat = ReboundTools::hat_vars$q_dot_s_hat,
  q_dot_s_bar = ReboundTools::bar_vars$q_dot_s_bar,
  C_dot_o_bar = ReboundTools::bar_vars$C_dot_o_bar
)

    Arguments

    .rebound_data

    A data frame of rebound information, likely created by rebound_analysis().

    graph_type

    See ReboundTools::graph_types. Default is ReboundTools::graph_types$consumption.

    graph_params

    Parameters that control the appearance of the graph. Default is ReboundTools::path_graph_params.

    q_dot_s_orig, C_dot_o_orig, f_Cs_orig, sigma

    See ReboundTools::orig_vars.

    q_dot_s_hat

    See ReboundTools::hat_vars.

    q_dot_s_bar, C_dot_o_bar

    See ReboundTools::bar_vars.

    Value

    A data frame of indifference curves for a consumption path graph.

    Details

    The consumption path graph is always indexed, so there is no indexed argument.

    Examples

    load_eeu_data() %>% 
  rebound_analysis() %>% 
  indifference_lines()
#> # A tibble: 617 × 15
#>    Refere…¹ Case  Origi…² Upgrade graph…³ line_…⁴ colour linew…⁵ linet…⁶ qs1_qs0
